intro: Elleanthus crinipes, commonly known as the silky tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and large, palmate leaves with a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, edible seeds. Elleanthus crinipes thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
